means: 使穿上衣服，使穿上盛装

sentence.Network_en: In those crowded streets her attire did not rate a second glance.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那些拥挤的街道她的穿着并未引起注意。

sentence.Network_en: He had no intention of changing his mode of attire.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French atirier, atirer 'equip', from a tire 'in order', of unknown origin

entry.def: Your attire is the clothes you are wearing.

example.ex: ...seven women dressed in their finest attire.

means.word_mean: 1. clothing of a distinctive style or for a particular occasion;
1. put on special clothes to appear particularly appealing and attractive;

sentences.sentence: "She never dresses up, even when she goes to the opera"
"The young girls were all fancied up for the party"

sentences.en: It is appropriate that everyone be suitably attired.
sentences.cn: 人人穿戴得体是恰当的。

sentences.en: He had no intention of changing his mode of attire.
Her attention was attracted by his peculiar attire.
sentences.cn: 他那奇特的服装引起了她的注意。

sentences.en: The bride was attired in white.
sentences.cn: 新娘穿一身洁白的礼服。
